DataElement.preferredDefinition: Identification of the status of lymphoproliferative disease prior to bone marrow transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lymphoproliferative Disorder Timepoint Transplantation Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by proliferation of lymphocytes at various stages of differentiation. Lymphoproliferative disorders can be neoplastic (clonal, as in lymphomas and leukemias) or reactive (polyclonal, as in infectious mononucleosis)._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disorder characterized by proliferation of lymphocytes at various stages of differentiation. Lymphoproliferative disorders can be neoplastic (clonal, as in lymphomas and leukemias) or reactive (polyclonal, as in infectious mononucleosis).

Concepts.definition: A disorder characterized by proliferation of lymphocytes at various stages of differentiation. Lymphoproliferative disorders can be neoplastic (clonal, as in lymphomas and leukemias) or reactive (polyclonal, as in infectious mononucleosis).

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

An abatement in intensity or degree (as in the manifestations of a disease).
